message.content:
To copy the contents of another cell in LibreOffice Calc and remove all single quotes, you can use the following formula:

=SUBSTITUTE(A1,"'","")

In this formula, A1 is the cell that contains the text you want to copy. The SUBSTITUTE function replaces all occurrences of the single quote character (') with an empty string ("").

For example, if the contents of cell A1 are "The 'quick' brown fox", the formula will return "The quick brown fox".
